description.narrative: Fo YWCA-SL worked with the Sierra Leone Network on the Right to Food (SiLNoRF) to secure rural women's land rights. The two organizations will facilitate land rights advocacy training for 40 leaders of rural women's groups; organize public meetings and stakeholder dialogues in three locations; and use print, digital, and radio media to share information on rural women's land rights. The goals of the grant were to strengthen the relationship and information exchange between rural women's groups of Kono District in the east, with those from Bombali District in the north, all of whom face challenging land rights every day; increase the capacity of rural women's groups in northern and eastern Sierra Leone to understand and claim their rights to access and own land, and more fully participate in decision-making about their land use rights; and increase the capacity of rural women's groups to advocate for their land rights via strategic media campaigns.
